sentence: Consumer stocks have turned broadly higher in late trade, with shares of consumer staples companies in the S&P 500 rising less than 0.1%, reversing a small decline earlier this afternoon, while shares of consumer discretionary firms in the S&P 500 were posting a more than 2.3% gain.

(+) Newell Brands ( NWL ) surged over 9% at one point on Monday after the housewares company said it has selected Christopher Peterson to be it new chief financial officer, effective next Monday, Dec. 3.
Peterson boasts an extensive track record at other consumer giants, including management-level jobs at Procter & Gamble ( PG ), Ralph Lauren ( RL ) and Revlon ( REV ).

He replaces The company previously said incumbent CFO and executive vice president Ralph Nicolettib has been planning to retire at the end of the year and will assist Peterson with the transition during his final month at Newell.

(+) Eldorado Resorts ( ERI ) climbed nearly 9% at one point on Monday after the casino and entertainment company announced a new, 20-year partnership agreement with Canadian online gaming provider The Stars Group (TSG,TSGI.TO) to develop online sports wagering.

Under terms of the proposed transaction, Eldorado will receive nearly 1.08 million Stars Group shares worth $25 million could receive additional shares in five years based on gaming revenue generated in its markets.

(+) General Motors (GM) was cruising nearly 6% higher, easing off an 8% mid-morning pace that followed the automaker announcing a major realignment of its operations, including plans to shutter three of its North American vehicle assembly facilities next year along with three overseas plants.
An estimated 14,000 employees, or about 15% of the company's salaried and salaried contract workers, will lose their jobs.

(+) WPP (WPP) was back near its session high, Monday rising almost 4% after the advertising and public relations shop announced plans to combine its Wunderman digital agency segment with its J. Walter Thompson division to form Wunderman Thompson, which will provide "creative, data, commerce, consulting and technology services" on a global scale.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
